title: Episode 57 - "Joshua"
guest_stars: Tony Bennett, Tom Arnold, Afro-Plane, Kathy Kinney, Ginny, the Dog Who Saves Cats, Paul Gilmartin, Annabelle Gurwitch, John Flansburgh, William, the King of Imagination, Ryah Rosenberg, Sean Medlock

transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: He's brash. He's bold. And, he takes no prisoners, except for Moltar and Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, how ya doin'?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (aiming his power bands) This ray has your name on it, but only if your name is Destructo. Peter Destructo.

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: His name?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Yes, he's Space Ghost, and he's your new world-wide marketing tool 2000. When it comes to your product or business, he's your space age pack horse.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (at his desk) Saddle me up, and ride me into the future.

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Hi, I'm David Caldwell, get ready for the adventure of a lifetime. Space Ghost 2000, rocketing into the future!

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Welcome to Ghost Planet Industries, gateway to humor for literally hundreds of television viewers. It all starts with the Space Ghost from Coast to Coast writers. Here they are, hard at work, fine-tuning a script for an upcoming episode. We'd better leave them to their work, they've got more comedy to write. Each of the jokes written by the comedy writing team are factory tested in a GPI research laboratory, using randomly selected focus group viewers.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That's not my hand, it's my pincer.

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Oh, that line needs a little reworking. ("pincer" is erased on chalk board; then, Andy gets an idea)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That's not my hand, it's my butt.

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Looks like we've got a winner! We'll take a closer look at closer look at the making of Space Ghost from Coast to Coast in a moment. But first...

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: It's a brand new world, everything you wear.

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: The sneakers on your feet: branded

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: The hat on your head: branded.

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: How about the coffee you drink? All branded.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It's time for me, and you, to learn a little bit about branding.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost, do you mean "branding" with a hot iron?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ha ha ha heh. No, Moltar, not that type of branding.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Then tell us, Space Ghost, what's "branding"?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Here, let me explain. Let's say you have a rowboat, a cow, and the big man.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You mean Clarence Clemmons?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Of course. Now, the cow wants to transport Clarence across the river. But remember, the cow is on fire, and Clarence has no hands or bucket, so he has to untilize his hooks, and the mighty power of his saxophone!

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost is talking about the three R's: Reliability, Ratings, and (Relivery, replaced by) Delivery. Let's start with R number one:

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: (multicolor text "RESEARCH" flies across screen, followed by various film clips) Based on our analysis of relative price value factors, subjective hosted product placement decisions versus generic yield acceptibility, our directly linked network programming identity and the investment in demographic icon synergisticality.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pops his head in) It's that simple, and that hard.

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Let's look at R number two: (multicolor text "POWER" flies across screen)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What's the real power of me?

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost is talking about the Feature Benefit Model (subtitle: FEATURE BENEFIT MODEL)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Remember, 'power' is not a dirty word.

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: In a moment, we'll take a closer look at Space Ghost as a Feature Benefit Model (subtitle: FEATURE BENEFIT MODEL)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (looking at his image in the studio monitor) I'm starting with the man in the mirror.

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: First, this:

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: An integral element of the success that is Space Ghost from Coast to Coast is the remarkable celebrity interviews.

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Here's a sneak peek at an upcoming interview with the one and only Tony Bennett.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Greetings!

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Let's join Space Ghost and the star of "Car Pool" and "Big Bully", Tom Arnold.

transcript.speaker: Tom Arnold
transcript.dialogue: Actually, that second show was called "Tom". This show is called "The Tom Show", which is different. And that, because I think it's easier to find in the TV Guide.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You should call it "Tommy".

transcript.speaker: Tom Arnold
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I thought of that, my grandma would like that. Um, but, you know, I'm not sure...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How about "Tom Tom the Tom"?

transcript.speaker: Tom Arnold
transcript.dialogue: What was that again? "Tom Tom the Tom"?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, "Tom Tom the Tom Tom." Tom.

transcript.speaker: Tom Arnold
transcript.dialogue: That's, that's, that's good. I mean, that's, that's okay...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (walks away from control room monitor)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey! Moltar, put your pants on and direct the show!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Get lost, man!

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Let's stop here. We don't want to give too much away. Now let's listen as Space Ghost tells us about some of his upcoming guests.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Rap group Afro-Plane. Female Kathy Kinney. Ginny, The Dog Who Saves Cats. "Dinner and A Movie" hosts Paul and Annabelle.

transcript.speaker: Paul Gilmartin
transcript.dialogue: How ya doin', Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Annabelle Gurwitch
transcript.dialogue: Oh, hey there!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: From the pop group "They Might Be Giants", John Flansburgh. And special surprise guest, William, the King of Imagination!

transcript.speaker: William
transcript.dialogue: My name is William, I am the King of Imagination. I am a modern wizard in training.

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Sporting goods.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Tennis, anyone?

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Psychic advisor.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Only I can see your future. I've been there!

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Dermatological creams and jellies.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (his zits disappear with a flash) Wow! Look out, girls!

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Who can turn the world on with a smile?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (pulls lever) Space Ghost! (monitor shows Space Ghost, his smile sparkles)

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Who can take a nothing day, and suddenly make it all seem worthwhile? (Space Ghost dances at his desk)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You know who!

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: That's right! And you too can take advantage of this manly lantern-like jaw. I mean, look at it!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (closeup of his jaw) Eh? There you go.

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Just think of how exciting your next corporate retreat will be with a special appearance by the man himself. (monitor shows Space Ghost dancing with a group of people at a corporate retreat)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (pulls lever) Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Here's a sample:

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (at his desk) Greetings, heating and cooling fixtures executives of America! Climate control! Am I right? (taps his card)

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: But that's not all. Space Ghost can also take care of all your landscaping needs, home or office.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (riding a lawn tractor) Dyin' out here! Can I get a glass of water?

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Imagine the envy of your business competitors when they see Space Ghost bush-hogging your shrubbery.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (as his cape gets caught in the mower) Oh! My cape! My cape! Aaaaaaa!

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Still not convinced? For a limited time only, if you take advantage of the power of the Space Ghost, you'll receive this deluxe cannister set! Think of it, a dashing superhero, and a deluxe cannister set, available this calendar year. And also, this shiny object! You heard right, a dashing superhero, a deluxe cannister set, and a shiny object, all in one out-of-this-world package! Oooh, and hey, look at this! (the old "disconnected thumb trick) (rim shot) Ow! How does he do that? I wonder... Now, look over here.

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Zorak's in the recording studio, about to record those funny lines that the writers were writing earlier. Let's listen:

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That's not my hand; it's your butt.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No no no, my butt.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Well, that's what I'm sayin'. It's your butt.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No, it's not your butt: my butt.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That's what I just said: your butt.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: My butt!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: So... your butt.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Just do the line!

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: From there, the tapes are put in a magic closet where they will sit for three magical days. After this magical waiting period, the tapes are then put.. somewhere. But, that's not important. What's important is that Space Ghost is your ticket to a solid financial future. (big $ appears, with cash register sound)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Your opportunity is unlimited!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Fermez la bouche!

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) What does that mean?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It means "shut your mouth"!

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: But I'm not even on your planet!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (pause) Who are you?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: As you can plainly see, life on the Ghost Planet is really fun! And you can be a part of that fun! Let's take a closer look.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Ho ho, yeah!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (behind a huge can of Mendoza's Tomato Juice) Drink this juice! It's goooood stuff!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: When it comes time to allocate your advertising dollars, and/or to make your endorsement selections, please let the Space Ghost be a part of the future of you!

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Why? Because Space Ghost from Coast to Coast is a solution with real value.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sputters) That makes sense even to a brash superhero such as me!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: That's right, SG.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's right, Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That's right, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's right, Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Brak
transcript.dialogue: That's right, Space Ghost, Zorak, and Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: That's right, guys. I guess that's why we call Space Ghost from Coast to Coast a valuable solution with real.

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: (a high-speed montage of past episode clips, plus a few surprises) So, what have we learned? (laughs) Heck, I don't know. That this is one crazy show! And, I'm Dick Dickenbach. Bye now!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos in) Hello, I'm Space Ghost. My guests are the winners of the "Haikuin' for Space Ghost" contest, Ryah Rosenberg and Sean Medlock. Zorak, play me to the desk and let's get this over with.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (plays some wailing Sharrock guitar on his keyboard)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to desk) Now, let's meet our first winner, Ryah Rosenberg.

transcript.speaker: Ryah Rosenberg
transcript.dialogue: (lowers from ceiling on monitor) Hey, great to be here.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Tell us a bit about yourself.

transcript.speaker: Ryah Rosenberg
transcript.dialogue: I am from Phoenix, Arizona...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, read your thing.

transcript.speaker: Ryah Rosenberg
transcript.dialogue: All right, my winning haiku went something like this:I'll level with you:Let me on your show, I wantA day off from school.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (pause) (blasts her from the monitor) Moltar, send out the other one.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (Monitor text alternates between:)

transcript.speaker: Sean Medlock
transcript.dialogue: (makes faces and funny noises)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Oops! (laughs) (throws lever) Oops! (throws lever again and again, making Sean contort) Oops! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar! Send out the other one!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Awright, awright. (throws lever, sending Sean to studio monitor)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay, Medlock, read your deal.

transcript.speaker: Sean Medlock
transcript.dialogue: I hope I don't win,The rules say to bring a friend,I don't have any.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You won for that?

transcript.speaker: Sean Medlock
transcript.dialogue: Mmm hmm, kind of surprising, isn't it?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yup. Goodnight, everybody.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: This is the end of the show.
